definition: a sudden drop from an upright position, do gymnastics, roll and turn skillfully
details:
noun
- a sudden drop from an upright position
= synonyms: fall
- an acrobatic feat of rolling or turning end over end
verb
- do gymnastics, roll and turn skillfully
- suffer a sudden downfall, overthrow, or defeat
- put clothes in a tumbling barrel, where they are whirled about in hot air, usually with the purpose of drying
= example: put clothes in a tumbling barrel, where they are whirled about in hot air, usually with the purpose of drying
- fall suddenly and sharply
= example: fall suddenly and sharply
- understand, usually after some initial difficulty
= synonyms: twig, get wise, get onto, latch on, cotton on, get it, catch on
- throw together in a confused mass
= example: throw together in a confused mass
- roll over and over, back and forth
- fall down, as if collapsing
= example: fall down, as if collapsing
= synonyms: topple
- fall apart
= synonyms: collapse, break down, crumble, crumple
- fly around
= example: fly around
= synonyms: whirl, whirl around
- cause to topple or tumble by pushing
= synonyms: tip, topple
